poem:
**Strategic Currents**

In the cloak of whispers, rivers run deep,  
Thames Water weaves through the city's sleep.  
Silver coins flow to counsel's hand,  
As shadows dance on business land.  
With a nod from a spook's keen eye,  
The tide turns silent under London's sky.  
A stream of secrets, where power and water lie.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Thames Water paid £1m-plus to corporate spooks firm part-owned by Starmer adviser A corporate intelligence company part-owned and formerly run by the prime minister’s business adviser has been paid more than £1m by Thames Water as the utilities firm tries to avoid renationalisation, the Guardian can reveal. Hakluyt, which was run by Varun Chandra until his appointment as Keir Starmer’s business adviser last July, has worked with Thames since 2023, providing political and strategic advice.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Thames Water paid £1m-plus to corporate spooks firm part-owned by Starmer adviser A corporate intelligence company part-owned and formerly run by the prime minister’s business adviser has been paid more than £1m by Thames Water as the utilities firm tries to avoid renationalisation, the Guardian can reveal. Hakluyt, which was run by Varun Chandra until his appointment as Keir Starmer’s business adviser last July, has worked with Thames since 2023, providing political and strategic advice.
